Sentencas: Solid oxide fuel cell (SOFC) is a promising energy conversion technology, but the high operating temperature caused by electrolytes impedes its widespread application.
Titulo: Surface reconstruction of β-Ga2O3 nanorod electrolyte for LT-SOFCs

Sentencas: The development of alternative electrolytes with fast ionic transport plays a vital role in tackling this challenge.
Titulo: Surface reconstruction of β-Ga2O3 nanorod electrolyte for LT-SOFCs

Sentencas: In this study, a new electrolyte is proposed based on the wide bandgap semiconductor Ga2O3, by using a facile surface treatment on the nanorods of beta-Ga2O3 in hydrogen.
Titulo: Surface reconstruction of β-Ga2O3 nanorod electrolyte for LT-SOFCs

Sentencas: The treatment reconstructs the surface of the beta-Ga2O3 nanorod to form a core-shell structure with an oxygen vacancy-rich shell.
Titulo: Surface reconstruction of β-Ga2O3 nanorod electrolyte for LT-SOFCs

Sentencas: The nanorod sample is applied as the electrolyte in SOFC, delivering a high ionic conductivity of 0.15 S cm(-1) and promising power densities of 485 mW cm(-2) at 550 degrees C. Further studies confirm dominated proton conduction in the electrolyte and propose different mechanisms to elucidate the fast proton transport in terms of surface reconstruction.
Titulo: Surface reconstruction of β-Ga2O3 nanorod electrolyte for LT-SOFCs

Sentencas: Particular attention is paid to the homo-junction at the core-shell interface by discussing the modulating effect of the junction s built-in field on proton diffusion.
Titulo: Surface reconstruction of β-Ga2O3 nanorod electrolyte for LT-SOFCs

Sentencas: This work develops a new electrolyte based on beta-Ga2O3 for LT-SOFC and presents an effective method of surface reductive reconstruction to enable fast proton conduction in semiconductor electrolytes.
Titulo: Surface reconstruction of β-Ga2O3 nanorod electrolyte for LT-SOFCs
